input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS - FDFA. Summary: Programme to Support Vocational Training and the Socio-Economic Integration of Young People (Baaradégé). Description: From 2012 to the present, Mali is experiencing a multidimensional crisis with implications such as insecurity, political, geopolitical and community tensions, massive displacements of people and the continued degradation of social services. base. These incidents affect almost the entire national territory. With 20% of schools closed, around 610,000 children are out of school. The literacy rate of young people aged 15 to 24 is around 35%. Also professional training remains marginal because a third of young Malians are neither in employment, nor in training, nor in school. Main CPV: 98300000 Miscellaneous services. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2026-01-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS - FDFA. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: STATE SECRETARIAT FOR ECONOMIC AFFAIRS (SECO). Summary: Resilient and Efficient Utilities in North Macedonia. Description: The project's main goal is to boost the resilience and efficiency of urban water and wastewater Utilities in North Macedonia and thereby contribute to the cities- economic development. To achieve this, the project aims to improve the organizations, operational and financial performance of seven Public Utilities while increasing their energy efficiency and expanding the use of renewable energy. Key supporting factors for success include the gradual upgrade of Utility infrastructure, as well as the integration of energy efficiency aspects in the regulatory and institutional framework. An Implementation Consultant will assist the Utilities with corporate development support to improve their business planning, reduce non-revenue water, adopt energy efficiency approaches for water and wastewater services, and implement renewable energy measures. Through the increased energy efficiency and a sound business planning, the project contributes to the sustainability of infrastructure investments which is a pre-requisite for economic development and to climate mitigation. On national level, the IC will support the Regulator to strengthen its capacities in the supervision of the Utilities- investment planning, energy audits and tariff structures. Find further information in the documentation. <br> Doc Title: Resilient and Efficient Utilities in North Macedonia <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-09-30. Closing Date: 2025-11-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: State Secretariat for Economic Affairs (SECO)

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS FDFA / SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION SDC. Summary: “Thematic Support Second Swiss Contribution to Eu Member States in the Health Domain” for the Period 01.02.2026 to 30.06.2029 in Switzerland and Abroad. Description: This mandate is placed within Switzerland-s second contribution to selected European Union (EU) member states. The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) is mainly responsible for half of the funds of the cohesion framework credit. Strengthening social and health systems is a key theme, with 12 individual programmes in 10 countries and a total budget of CHF 100 million. The mandate consists of a dual-level support structure for enhancing health programme implementation in selected EU member states through Swiss expertise. The first level involves technical backstopping, where the tenderer provides expert input on various health-related topics. The second level focuses on organizing study visits to Switzerland for delegations from partner countries of Switzerland-s second contribution to selected EU member states. <br> Doc Title: “Thematic Support Second Swiss Contribution to EU Member States in the Health Domain” for the period 01.02.2026 to 30.06.2029 in Switzerland and abroad <br> Contract Type: services. Summary: Mekong Land Initiative (Mli), Inception Phase 01.03.2026 - 30.09.2026 (7 Months) Phase 1 01.10.2026 - 30.09.2030. Description: The Mekong Land Initiative (MLI) stands for the transformation of SDC-s (Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation) engagement in improving land governance and in accelerating the implementation of global and regional land governance principles in the Mekong region. The investment in the MLI is closely aligned with Switzerland-s International Cooperation Strategy 2025-2028, particularly its thematic focus on climate change, environmental protection, and the sustainable management of natural resources. The project aims to achieve the following development results: Smallholder women and men farmers in CLMV (Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar, and Vietnam) countries, especially those from ethnic minorities, enjoy secure, equitable and sustained access and control over agricultural land and forest and benefit from sustainable livelihoods as responsible agricultural investments (RAI) practices become more widely adopted. <br> Doc Title: Mekong Land Initiative (MLI), Inception phase 01.03.2026 - 30.09.2026 (7 months) Phase 1 01.10.2026 - 30.09.2030 <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CANTON OF LUCERNE, OFFICE ASYLUM AND REFUGEE.. Summary: Security Services for the Agency Asylum and Refugee System (Daf). Description: The agency asylum and refugee (DAF) of the Health and Social Department (GSD) is responsible for the strategic and operational management of the asylum and refugee system in the canton of Lucerne. It implements the political guidelines of the cantonal and government council and at the same time acts as Interface between the federal government, canton and municipalities. In the context of social assistance, in addition to the accommodation and support, the DAF also ensures financial support for people from the asylum and refugee area. It also promotes its integration into society and the labor market. In addition, the DAF organizes emergency aid for people who have to leave Switzerland if necessary.<br> Main CPV: 79710000 services from Security services. Published Date: 2025-08-20. Description: The transport companies of the city of Zurich (VBZ) operate a customer service organization called "Customer Value Center". These are currently switches, telephone, email, live chat and social media.<br> The incoming inquiries range from simple information such as timetable information to highly complex complaints, which are processed by a dedicated team. Customers are also supported in dealing with the "E-channels" (ZVV app, web shop, etc.). The sale of tickets and subscriptions takes place at the counter. In the lost property office, mainly Find objects received and conveyed - contact with the customers is here via the phone and switch.<br> In order to be able to keep the quality of advice of employees in the CVC at a high level, the employees go through an extensive training program (oral and written Communication, dealing with customer reactions, resilience, etc.).<br> With this tender, an extensive training program is to be determined according to the tender documents.<br> Training services customer service<br> The transport companies of the city of Zurich (VBZ) operate one Could.... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: LUKS SPITALBETRIEBE AG INFORMATIK. Summary: Procurement Managed Printing Service (Mps). Description: With the present tender, providers are sought who conclude a framework contract for the procurement of sustainable printers and MFP and optionally from zebra label printers as well as a SLA for services related to the devices procured via the framework contract with the LUKS want.<br> The framework contract to be concluded with the surveyor has a term of 5 years and can be extended twice by 2 years if the life cycles of the devices can be extended accordingly. At the time of the conclusion of the contract, the LUKS decides whether the devices by Buy, can be obtained by rental/purchase or rent.<br> With your offer, the provider submits extensive solution concepts for the structure, operation and safety for the printers and MFP at all main and subordinates of the LUK, with roll-out until June 30, 2026.<br> That with the service provider SLA to be locked up includes all activities from acceptance, labeling and inventory to the right delivery and commissioning of the devices procured via the framework contract, the on-site support, repair services, the proactive maintenance, the Special maintenance of the important devices and the SPOC. Optionally, the SLA also includes the existing label printers and all associated activities.<br> In the knowledge that the joint development of such a comprehensive procurement and roll-out plan and the definition of on the LUKS Wing .... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE OF STATISTICS. Summary: Bks-2090 Hr Rental 2026-2030. Description: The Federal Office of Statistics BFS is the national center of Switzerland's public statistics. It produces and publishes important statistical information on the condition and development of the population, economy, society, space and the environment. It complements this with overarching Analyzes, develops indicator systems for the recording of complex facts, develops scenarios of future developments and ensures historical database.<br> All activities of the BFS are based on the BTATG, the Ordinance on the Organization of National Statistics and further specific legal bases. In the appendix to the regulation, over 200 concrete statistical activities are listed.<br> Statistics production ranges from the conception of a survey, data acquisition, quality control, customer support, data evaluation to the Publication.<br> In phases of large workload, the BFS uses the support of external personnel lenders. Since this can be the case in the entire statistical production process, the requirements for the personnel to be mediated vary.<br> To failable failures (Long -term abbreviations, maternity leave, etc.), the BFS uses employees of external personnel lendingers.<br> Survey personnel<br> Underlos 1a: employee without experience<br> Underlos 1b: employee with experience<br> Underlos 1c: group leader<br> See specification and Appendix 6<br> Hotlin .... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS FDFA / SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION (SDC) / EMBASSY OF SWITZERLAND IN NEPAL. Summary: Nepal - Municipal Revenue Enhancement Project - Inception Phase: 01.02.2026 - 16.07.2026 Phase I: 17.07.2026 - 31.12.2029 Duration: 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2029 (47 Months). Description: Nepal`s Constitution sees the local government (LG) as closest to its people with an important service delivery function. To enact this important role, the Constitution empowers local governments with a series of competences and responsibilities in particular it empowers LGs, to introduce and manage 12 different types of local taxes. Among others, these include property and house rent taxes, land and building registration fees, tourism fees, business and advertisement tax.<br> Main CPV: 98300000 Miscellaneous services. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SECO STAATSSEKRETARIAT FÜR WIRTSCHAFT - INTERNATIONALE ARBEITSFRAGEN DAIN. Summary: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027. Description: Objective: To promote dialogue between stakeholders in order to strengthen the implementation of human rights in the practices of Swiss companies. Activities: · (Measure 3) Organise the third national forum on business and human rights in 2026 and roundtable discussions involving companies, academia, non-governmental organisations, the public sector and international organisations. · (Measure 5 reinforced) Ensuring the transfer of knowledge and best practices between the various actors. In doing so: o Promote dialogue between stakeholders, including business associations and civil society, by supporting roundtable discussions and discussion platforms. The aim is to promote constructive cooperation by developing practical solutions for better respect for human rights in business activities. The focus here is primarily on multi-stakeholder initiatives in the cocoa, gold, sustainable textiles and coffee sectors, as well as on the implementation of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the International Code of Conduct for Private Security Service Providers, in which Switzerland already plays an active role. <br> Doc Title: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027 <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-28. Closing Date: 2025-09-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: EIDGENÖSSISCHES DEPARTEMENT FÜR AUSWÄRTIGE ANGELEGENHEITEN EDA. Summary: Urban Resilience, Inclusion and Socio-Economic Empowerment (U-Rise). Description: The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) plans to launch the "Urban Resilience, Inclusion, and Socioeconomic Empowerment (U-RISE)" project in Zimbabwe under the Swiss Cooperation Programme for Zimbabwe and Zambia (2023-2026). The project aims to improve the economic resilience and well-being of vulnerable urban populations in selected secondary cities in Zimbabwe. Zimbabwe-s secondary cities face interconnected challenges, such as high unemployment, dependence on the informal sector, climate vulnerability, and underdeveloped infrastructure. U-RISE aligns with Zimbabwe-s National Development Strategy 1 (2021-2025), National Urban Policy (2023-2026), and Climate Change Policy, while contributing to Switzerland-s Foreign Policy Strategy 2024-2027 and the International Cooperation Strategy 2025-2028, with a focus on jobs, resilience, and climate adaptation. <br> Doc Title: Urban Resilience, Inclusion and Socio-Economic Empowerment (U-RISE) <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-18. Closing Date: 2025-08-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The project aims to improve the economic resilience and well-being of vulnerable urban populations in selected secondary cities in Zimbabwe. Zimbabwe-s secondary cities face interconnected challenges, such as high unemployment, dependence on the informal sector, climate vulnerability, and underdeveloped infrastructure. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: WEMU ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT MACROECONOMIC SUPPORT. Summary: Fiscal Governance for Local Reconstruction and Recovery Program in Ukraine. Description: SECO is procuring the services of an implementing agency for the Fiscal Governance for Local Reconstruction and Recovery Program in Ukraine. This program aims to strengthen capacities of selected Ukrainian cities to raise and effectively manage public finances, which is crucial groundwork for recovery and reconstruction. A first phase is foreseen to run between 2025 and 2029 and work with the partner cities of Zhytomyr, Lviv, Vinnytsia, Khmelnytskyi and Chernivtsi.<br> Main CPV: 75131000 Government services. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: POPULATION SERVICE. Summary: Mandate to Revise the Annual Accounts of the Vaudois Establishment of Migrants Reception (Evam) According to Art. 13 of the Law of March 7, 2006 on Assistance to Asylum Applicants and Certain Categories of .... Description: Mandate to revise the annual accounts of the Vaudois Establishment of Migrants Reception (EVAM) according to art. 13 of the law of March 7, 2006 on assistance to asylum applicants and certain categories of ...<br> The Vaudois establishment for the reception of migrants (Evam or Establishment) is an establishment of public law with legal personality established by art. 9 of the cantonal law of March 7, 2006 on assistance to asylum applicants and certain categories of foreigners (Lara, BLV 142.21).<br> The establishment establishes its own accounts in accordance with its organizational regulations subject to The approval of the Council of State, in accordance with art. 18 Lara.<br> In accordance with art. 5 Lara, the Council of State designates a revision body and approves the annual accounts of the EVAM accompanied by the report relating to it by the revision body (see also art. 64 Lara).<br> The purpose of revising Accounts consists in informing the Council of State on the regularity and legality of the accounts and annual accounts, as well as on the existence of an internal control system. This means that the revision body must be able to assess the conformity of accounting operations and states financiers in relation to the legal prescriptions in force as well as to the standards of the profession. In particular, the reviewer must formulate a recommendation for the approval of the annual accounts (art. 728b, al. 2 ch. 4 CO), as well as an opinion concerning the internal control system (SCI), having regard to his contribution in the execution of the control and the determination of his extent (art. 728a, al. 2 CO). In the case of this call for tenders, the revision body is also requested to issue .... Published Date: 2025-07-14. Closing Date: 2025-09-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS FDFA. Summary: «Swiss Memorial for the Victims of National Socialism» a Place of Remembrance in the City of Bern. Description: The Federal Council is committed to ensuring that the victims of Nazi persecution and the Holocaust are not forgotten. In April 2023, funded therefore CHF 2.5 million for the creation of a memorial site dedicated to the victims of Nazism. The memorial will be erected in the city of Bern and will be accessible to all. The aim of the procedure is to select a project that commemorates the victims of Nazism, encourages reflection on Switzerland's history during the Nazi era and, in light of the mass crimes committed by the Nazis, questions historical responsibility for the present. The selected project should have a contemporary and aesthetically effective design that offers multiple intellectual and emotional approaches. <br> Doc Title: «Swiss Memorial for the Victims of National Socialism» A place of remembrance in the city of Bern <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-14. Closing Date: 2025-10-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS FDFA

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SPECIALIST FOR PROCUREMENT CITY OF BERN. Summary: Steam Center Bern, Cultural Use, 2028-2030. Description: The steam center is an important cultural location and an important platform for contemporary cultural work in Bern. In a selective procedure, the city of Bern is looking for a sponsorship that in the contract period from 2028 the content, financial, personnel and organizational responsibility for this cultural site. The steam center as a cultural site is out of the question. The sponsorship is intended to organize a dense and diverse offer for the population, maintain cooperations with other cultural actors and be a partner for the Bernese dance. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE OF CONSTRUCTION AND LOGISTICS UFCL. Summary: (B25003) Swiss Center of Milan. Description: The Swiss Confederation owns a real estate complex in Milan called the Swiss Center of Milan (CSM). This complex includes the buildings located in via Palestro 2 and 4 and in via del Vecchio Politecnico 1 and 3. It consists of two separate construction elements: a higher element (tower) and a lower one (low body). The tower consists of 21 floors. The low body includes five floors above ground. The premises of the two elements of the real estate complex are currently used by 17 independent leases.<br> The Swiss Center of Milan in Italy is considered a permanent organization of the Swiss Confederation which carries out a commercial activity in relation to the management of the real estate complex.<br> The latter perform maintenance duties and technical control, concierge and custodian service, as well as general safety control. The activities carried out in the CSM are qualified as commercial.<br> The exercise of the CSM as a permanent organization should not be altered and constitutes a prerequisite for the future supply of services. The Duties mentioned will therefore also be carried out in the future by the CSM employees and are not the subject of this announcement.<br> The goal of the announcement is to find a bidder that guarantees the supply of services inherent in the commercial, technical and operational management of the complex .... Published Date: 2025-06-26. Closing Date: 2025-08-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS FDFA. Summary: External Evaluation of the Geneva Centres for the Period 01.11.2025 to 30.05.2026 in Geneva. Description: The external evaluation concerns three Geneva-based Centres of excellence supported by the Swiss Confederation: the Geneva Centre for Security Policy (GCSP), focused on international security and diplomacy, the Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining (GICHD), focused on mine action, and the Geneva Centre for Security Sector Governance (DCAF), which promotes good governance in the security sector. These Centres are independent foundations primarily funded by Switzerland, with additional contributions from other donors. An evaluation is mandated under the current federal framework credit (2024-2027) of CHF 129.7 million. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the performance of the Centres across six criteria: relevance, coherence, effectiveness, efficiency, impact, and sustainability. It will consider how well each Centre contributes to its field, how aligned it is with Swiss foreign policy, and how effectively it uses resources to achieve its goals. The deliverables for this external evaluation are: - an Inception Report detailing methodology and evaluation questions - a draft Final Report for feedback from stakeholders - a Final Report The evaluation findings will inform the drafting and development of the next federal framework credit for the Geneva Centres, covering the period 2028-2031. <br> Doc Title: External Evaluation of the Geneva Centres for the period 01.11.2025 to 30.05.2026 in Geneva <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-06-24. Closing Date: 2025-09-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS FDFA
output.Summary: External Evaluation of the Geneva Centres for the Period 01.11.2025 to 30.05.2026 in Geneva

These Centres are independent foundations primarily funded by Switzerland, with additional contributions from other donors. An evaluation is mandated under the current federal framework credit (2024-2027) of CHF 129.7 million. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the performance of the Centres across six criteria: relevance, coherence, effectiveness, efficiency, impact, and sustainability. It will consider how well each Centre contributes to its field, how aligned it is with Swiss foreign policy, and how effectively it uses resources to achieve its goals. The deliverables for this external evaluation are: - an Inception Report detailing methodology and evaluation questions - a draft Final Report for feedback from stakeholders - a Final Report The evaluation findings will inform the drafting and development of the next federal framework credit for the Geneva Centres, covering the period 2028-2031. <br> Doc Title: External Evaluation of the Geneva Centres for the period 01.11.2025 to 30.05.2026 in Geneva <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: EIDGENÖSSISCHES DEPARTEMENT FÜR AUSWÄRTIGE ANGELEGENHEITEN EDA. Summary: Urban Resilience, Inclusion and Socio-Economic Empowerment (U-Rise). Description: The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) plans to launch the "Urban Resilience, Inclusion, and Socioeconomic Empowerment (U-RISE)" project in Zimbabwe under the Swiss Cooperation Programme for Zimbabwe and Zambia (2023-2026). The project aims to improve the economic resilience and well-being of vulnerable urban populations in selected secondary cities in Zimbabwe. Zimbabwe-s secondary cities face interconnected challenges, such as high unemployment, dependence on the informal sector, climate vulnerability, and underdeveloped infrastructure. U-RISE aligns with Zimbabwe-s National Development Strategy 1 (2021-2025), National Urban Policy (2023-2026), and Climate Change Policy, while contributing to Switzerland-s Foreign Policy Strategy 2024-2027 and the International Cooperation Strategy 2025-2028, with a focus on jobs, resilience, and climate adaptation. <br> Doc Title: Urban Resilience, Inclusion and Socio-Economic Empowerment (U-RISE) <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-06-18. Closing Date: 2025-08-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: DIRECTORATE GENERAL OF THE ENVIRONMENT (DGE) - DIRECTORATE OF ENERGY OF THE STATE OF VAUD (LOYCO SA). Summary: Design and Production of Communication Equipment for the Vaud State Energy Department. Description: 'Pseah Forum Theatre Implementation and Localisation' for the Period 1 October 2025 to 30 September 2029 in the Sdc's Partner Countries in Africa, South East Asia, Eastern Europe, Mena Region, Central... <br> 'PSEAH Forum Theatre implementation and localisation' for the period 1 October 2025 to 30 September 2029 in the SDC's partner countries in Africa, South East Asia, Eastern Europe, MENA region, Central Asia and Latin America, and in Switzerland <br> The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) has a zero-tolerance policy with regard to sexual exploitation, abuse and harassment (SEAH). The SDC has developed the PSEAH Forum Theatre (live theatre and video tool) in order to raise awareness among staff and implementing partners. The live theatre has been performed at various events for Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA) employees and partner organisations in diverse global settings including New York, Geneva and Rome. Localisation initiatives for the PSEAH Forum Theatre have been piloted in Bukavu, Bujumbura, Addis Ababa and Harare. As a follow-up measure, the SDC plans to help global PSEAH localisation efforts by allowing at least 9 regions/countries in Africa, South East Asia, Eastern Europe, MENA region, Central Asia and Latin America to adapt and contextualise the PSEAH Forum Theatre for further dissemination and long-term implementation in different cultural settings and languages for different target groups. <br> Doc Title: 'PSEAH Forum Theatre implementation and localisation' for the period 1 October 2025 to 30 September 2029 in the SDC's partner countries in Africa, South East Asia, Eastern Europe, MENA region, Central Asia and Latin America, and in Switz.... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: OFFICE FOR ENERGY AND TRANSPORT. Summary: Project Management for the Development of the Cantonal Energy Strategy. Description: A cantonal energy strategy is developed as part of the project. The aim is to make an overall show of the relevant aspects in the energy sector, to define strategic impact directions and to classify specific topics. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AFFAIRS, EDUCATION AND RESEARCH EAER. Summary: Project Ur_01132-01 for the Implementation of the ‘Circular Electronics Initiative (Cei)- Programme (Mid-2025 to Mid-2029). Description: The implementing agency is the entity in charge of overall programme management, including operational, administrative and financial management. The overall development objective of the Circular Electronics Initiative is to develop framework conditions that enable the implementation of sustainable re-use and recycling of WEEE (Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment) practices in SECO partner countries. The programme is focusing on four elements: * development of an adequate legislative, policy and institutional framework; * clear normative requirements and verification/enforcement mechanisms ensuring a level playing field; * an appropriate, professionally functioning collection and treatment (including re-use and recycling technology), and * statistics and monitoring. Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) will be the overarching concept guiding work on these elements. <br> Doc Title: Project UR_01132-01 for the implementation of the ‘Circular Electronics initiative (CEI)- Programme (mid-2025 to mid-2029) <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: EDA / DEZA. Summary: Regional Groundwater Management in Central Asia - Inception Phase 01.05.2025 - 31.01.2026 (9 Months) and Phase 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2030 (59 Months). Description: The Regional Groundwater Management project addresses critical issues of water scarcity, overexploitation, and pollution of groundwater in Central Asia. Groundwater is essential for agriculture, domestic use, and industrial activities, especially in water-scarce areas, where it fulfils a significant share of water demand. Switzerland, building on its experience with the GGRETA project, seeks to enhance regional cooperation of groundwater among Central Asia countries. The initiative aims to close data gaps, promote conjunctive water management, and foster robust policies and institutional frameworks. By raising awareness, improving capacity, and introducing state-of-the-art technologies, the project seeks to protect groundwater resources and ensure their sustainable use. Furthermore, the project promotes access to clean water, the strengthening of ecosystems, and enhanced climate resilience. Switzerland's involvement underscores its commitment to sustainable development, peacebuilding, and achieving the SDGs in Central Asia. <br> Doc Title: Regional Groundwater Management in Central Asia - Inception Phase 01.05.2025 - 31.01.2026 (9 months) and Phase 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2030 (59 months) <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-01-10. Closing Date: 2025-02-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Switzerland, building on its experience with the GGRETA project, seeks to enhance regional cooperation of groundwater among Central Asia countries. The initiative aims to close data gaps, promote conjunctive water management, and foster robust policies and institutional frameworks. By raising awareness, improving capacity, and introducing state-of-the-art technologies, the project seeks to protect groundwater resources and ensure their sustainable use. Furthermore, the project promotes access to clean water, the strengthening of ecosystems, and enhanced climate resilience. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: EDA / DEZA. Summary: Regional Groundwater Management in Central Asia - Inception Phase 01.05.2025 - 31.01.2026 (9 Months) and Phase 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2030 (59 Months). Description: The Regional Groundwater Management project addresses critical issues of water scarcity, overexploitation, and pollution of groundwater in Central Asia. Groundwater is essential for agriculture, domestic use, and industrial activities, especially in water-scarce areas, where it fulfils a significant share of water demand. Switzerland, building on its experience with the GGRETA project, seeks to enhance regional cooperation of groundwater among Central Asia countries. The initiative aims to close data gaps, promote conjunctive water management, and foster robust policies and institutional frameworks. By raising awareness, improving capacity, and introducing state-of-the-art technologies, the project seeks to protect groundwater resources and ensure their sustainable use. Furthermore, the project promotes access to clean water, the strengthening of ecosystems, and enhanced climate resilience. Switzerland's involvement underscores its commitment to sustainable development, peacebuilding, and achieving the SDGs in Central Asia. <br> Doc Title: Regional Groundwater Management in Central Asia - Inception Phase 01.05.2025 - 31.01.2026 (9 months) and Phase 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2030 (59 months) <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2024-12-16. Closing Date: 2025-02-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Regional Groundwater Management in Central Asia - Inception Phase 01.05.2025 - 31.01.2026 (9 Months) and Phase 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2030 (59 Months)

Groundwater is essential for agriculture, domestic use, and industrial activities, especially in water-scarce areas, where it fulfils a significant share of water demand. Switzerland, building on its experience with the GGRETA project, seeks to enhance regional cooperation of groundwater among Central Asia countries. The initiative aims to close data gaps, promote conjunctive water management, and foster robust policies and institutional frameworks. By raising awareness, improving capacity, and introducing state-of-the-art technologies, the project seeks to protect groundwater resources and ensure their sustainable use. Furthermore, the project promotes access to clean water, the strengthening of ecosystems, and enhanced climate resilience. Switzerland's involvement underscores its commitment to sustainable development, peacebuilding, and achieving the SDGs in Central Asia. <br> Doc Title: Regional Groundwater Management in Central Asia - Inception Phase 01.05.2025 - 31.01.2026 (9 months) and Phase 01.02.2026 - 31.12.2030 (59 months) <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SWISS STATE SECRETARIAT FOR ECONOMIC AFFAIRS (SECO)/ WEIN. Summary: International Implementing Agency for the Municipal Infrastructure Development Programme - Project Preparation Facility Ukraine (With Option for a Second Phase). Description: The Municipal Infrastructure Development Programme (MIDP) - Project Preparation Facility (PPF) seeks to enable urban infrastructure projects in Ukraine through the inclusion of Swiss expertise by supporting project preparation, implementation of quick-win measures, co-financing of projects and strengthening of business networks. The overall objective of the MIDP is that the Ukrainian population benefits from improved or re-established urban public services. The Facility seeks to contribute to this overall objective by enabling the implementation of urban infrastructure projects for Ukraine-s reconstruction. The underlying assumption is that well-prepared urban infrastructure projects are more likely to be implemented and to contribute sustainably to improved public services. The Facility is structured along three components with a focus on basic urban infrastructure, flexibility and scalability. Component 1 finances preparatory work for urban infrastructure projects as well as quick-win measures. Component 2 co-finances the implementation of selected urban infrastructure projects. Component 3 strengthens established Swiss-Ukraine business networks. The Facility will actively screen the priority list of projects within Ukraine-s PIM, check those against Switzerland-s criteria, seize upcoming opportunities and react to ad hoc demands through different means. Quick-win measures are small operational measures, demonstration projects or investment projects that can be implemented .... Published Date: 2024-11-25. Closing Date: 2025-01-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
